greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Diagonal indices of Greedy Queens (see A065188).
comment: a(n) is the index of the diagonal of the n-th queen.  The main diagonal has index 0, upper (lower) diagonals have positive (negative) indices.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The first queen is in the main diagonal, the second queen is in the first lower diagonal, the third queen is in the second upper diagonal, ... :
maple: # Maple program from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 03 2016
for n from 1 to M2 do
for s from ss[n-1]+1 to M2 do
for i from 0 to s do
not member(x-y,dd,'p') then sw:=1; break; fi;
if sw=-1 then lprint("error, n=",n); break; fi;
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 30 2016
